title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Client brought in a macbook - 820-00928 that wasn't turning on.

It takes in 20V  .1A- .8A fluctuating on all 4 ports
Liquid damage on U3906 area 
No Voltage on Big coils 

Cleaned up corrosion
Lifted U3906 removed corrosion. 
With a new known good battery it takes 2-3A - cpu doesnt get hot

PPBUS_G3H is present
PP3v3_SUS is present
CPU Lines not present / 2OHMS to ground
SMC Reset/Bypass made both fans spin at max w/ new battery but no display

Seems like its trying to turn on but cant complete the sequence

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Do you get CPU core voltage, when the board turns on (SMC reset/bypass)?
If yes, what is the voltage after 10-15s?
Also check USB activity, in this case.
Did you try known good BIOS?

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
CPUCORE_BOOT1: 4.8V
CPUCORE_BOOT2: 4.8v
CPUCORE_BOOT3: 4.8v
CPUCORE_BP1: 4.8v
CPUCORE_PHASE1: 0v
CPUCORE_PHASE2: 0v
CPUCORE_ISNS1_N: 0v
CPUCORE_SW1: 0v

There is USB Activity 
I have not tried a known good bios yet

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Impossible to get USB activity, without CPU core voltage.
Don't confuse USB power with activity!

If no CPU core, which other voltage appears on the board, when fans spin?
Check on all big coils.

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
The USB gets power but no communication/activity.

None of the big CPU coils get voltage on them 

L7900: 1.2v
L8410: 3.3v
L7960: 0.95v
L8000: 1.0v

PPBUS_G3H: 11.34
PP3v3_sus: 3.29
PP3v3_G3H: 3.3
PP5V_S0: 5.1

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Did you check L8020 too?
No voltage at L7330?

ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high?

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is required to enable CPU power supplies.
Check U7800 (1 OF 10) power good signals.

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
These are the signals I could find test points for -

P1V8SUS_PGOOD: 3.3V
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD: .04V
P5VS4_PGOOD: 3.2V
S5_PWRGD is good

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Power good signals from the power supplies controlled by U7800 directly, are not routed externally.
So check presence of voltages from pages 71 & 72.

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
Took a second look over the board & noticed u8295 getting hot. Removed the chip and Pin 5&6 were short (PP3v3_s0_left)

Used an infrared camera and sent 1.8v through the line and it led to C2991(PP3v3_TBT_X_S0). Removed the Cap but short is still present.

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
You can inject until 3.5V without problems.
U2800 is the first suspect there.
Lift its metal shield to properly check if heats up.

title: 820-00928 20V Not turning on
message:
U2800 was heating up after injecting 3V into the into Pin 5/6 on U8295

Replaced U2800 and everything is looking good. Thank you for the help.
